comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Zachary Erhard; Chester Cornelius Hoff (1891-1998); George Simmons; Bert Daniels; and E. Bergen of the 1913 New York Yankees most likely in 1912 at Pennsylvania Station. "Mike Bergen Pilots Recruits, Who Shy at Photographers at the Station.. The Yankee recruits who started for Atlanta yesterday are the most modest lot of ball players that ever left the city to try for the major leagues. At the Pennsylvania Station yesterday, when Mike Bergen piloted them toward the train, they shied at the photographers like a bunch of debutantes." Source: New York Times; March 3, 1912 People: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chet_Hoff

comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: This was when the Yankees had a lousy team, before they got Babe Ruth from Boston.
